messages.message:
They have these calls blocked in their QA environment, it has been blocked for over a month or two with no issues seen.  They are going to go ahead and block them in prod, I told them we don't know where this is coming from and don't anticipate any issues from blocking it since they didn't see issues in QA.

We also deploy to a number of other customers that have all outside access blocked
Wow, that's crazy. Maybe we can configure Flask to not do that :slightly_smiling_face:

im not sure that its flask... I was getting nowhere trying to research this so I actually described the issue to ChatGPT and it said that some python libraries like Flask can sometimes try to resolve dependencies at runtime lol
